headline: Four years of war in Ukraine: Odesa's complex 'derussification'
description: The southern Ukrainian city, long under the influence of Russia and then the Soviet Union due to its access to the Black Sea, is continuing the process of dismantling the pro-Russian narrative and reclaiming the city, much to the chagrin of those who wish to preserve its Russian 'cultural heritage.'

headline: The political stakes of organized crime in Israel
Paris municipal elections: Far-right candidate Knafo's platform is full of dubious calculations
PSG star Achraf Hakimi faces trial for rape
description: 'I await this trial calmly, which will allow the truth to come out publicly,' said the 27-year-old Moroccan international, who has always denied any assault or rape in this case.

headline: EU plunged into uncertainty over US trade deal
description: The European Parliament suspended the ratification of the Turnberry agreement on Monday after the US Supreme Court struck down tariffs imposed by the Trump administration. But European imports now face a new tax introduced by the American president.

headline: London Fashion Week: A season of reinvention
description: From Burberry's urban glamour to Simone Rocha's sportswear revival, fashion houses have revamped their appeal for the fall/winter 2026-2027 collections, presented from February 19 to 23 in the British capital.

headline: 2030 Alps Games: Around 40 projects remain to be completed as the deadline nears and timelines tighten
description: With four years to go before the Winter Olympic and Paralympic Games open in France, and just three and a half years before the expected delivery of construction projects, consultations with developers are ongoing.

After Heineken announces job cuts, the beer market faces major upheaval

Giorgia Meloni's strong poll numbers, a deceptive success

The secrets of neighing are finally revealed
Dark Bank: American suspected of leading an international criminal organization extradited to France
description: Huzefa Hafiz Ismail arrived on French soil on Friday. He was arrested in August 2024 in Texas at the request of French judicial authorities, who suspect him of leading a vast money laundering network.

headline: The 'impossible' task of counting deaths at sea
description: The International Organization for Migration and migrant aid NGOs simultaneously record deaths at sea in the Mediterranean and Atlantic, but often come up with very different figures. Why?

headline: Will French investigators soon use American DNA databases to solve cold cases?
description: In the SURE bill submitted on February 19, the justice minister plans to introduce an article that would, in particular, allow 'the use of genetic genealogy' in certain cases. These DNA samples come from 'recreational' tests offered by companies over the internet.

headline: Trump and Iran: Threats and unanswered questions
